abstract: BP began a series of divestitures in 2010 to pay for its oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico. Despite paying at least $38 billion for the spill, the British energy giant remains committed to high-risk exploration in deepwater fields. From Australia to Texas, the company has been selling older, smaller assets considered to be low-growth potential.
snippet: BP began a series of divestitures in 2010 to pay for its oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico. Despite paying at least $38 billion for the spill, the British energy giant remains committed to high-risk exploration in deepwater fields. From Australia to...
lead_paragraph: BILLION-DOLLAR SALES BY BP BP began a series of divestitures in 2010 to pay for its oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico. Despite paying at least $38 billion for the spill, the British energy giant remains committed to high-risk exploration in deepwater fields. From Australia to Texas, the company has been selling older, smaller assets considered to be low-growth potential.

headline.main: Graphics: Sales by BP, and Ranking the Top Oil Companies
